action.action-desc: Mr. Costa (for himself, Mr. Fulcher, and Mr. Valadao) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to increase surface water and groundwater storage, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Every Drop Counts Act.

subsection.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 40903(b)(1) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (43 U.S.C. 3203(b)(1)(B)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The following projects shall be eligible for consideration for a grant under this section:

subclause.text: has water storage capacity of not less than 200 acre-feet and not more than 30,000 acre-feet; and

item.text: increases surface water or groundwater storage; or
conveys water, directly or indirectly, to or from surface water or groundwater storage.

clause.header: Average annual project life acre-feet capacity

subclause.text: has water storage capacity of recharges not less than 200 acre-feet and not more than 150,000 acre-feet on an average annual basis over the life of the project for storage or use; and

item.text: conveys water, directly or indirectly, to or recovers water from groundwater storage;
both increases groundwater aquifer storage and conveys water, directly or indirectly, to or recovers water from groundwater storage; and

subsection.text: Section 40903(e) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (43 U.S.C. 3203(e)) is amended by striking 5 and inserting 10.

section.text: Nothing in the amendment made by section 2 shall be construed—

paragraph.text: to supersede or in any manner affect or conflict with State water law, Federal water law, interstate compacts, or treaty obligations;
to authorize any acquisition of water by the Federal Government; or
to supersede or infringe on any water rights.
